metadata.title: CVE-2019-20170 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in GPAC version 0.8.0 and0.9.0-development-20191109. There is an invalid pointer dereference in thefunction GF_IPMPX_AUTH_Delete() in odf/ipmpx_code.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-20170` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gpac - 1.0.1+dfsg1-3
gpac-modules-base - 1.0.1+dfsg1-3
libgpac10 - 1.0.1+dfsg1-3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gpac package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.0.1+dfsg1-3').
